page.title: 01Low Hills NE Ludlow
page.content: This is an area of undulating escarpment,generally over 230m above sea level where it overlooks the valley of the River Corve and tributary, Pye Brook, at about 115m. The latter takes most of the drainage, to the north andwest in Clee Brook and Strand brook in valleys over 75m deep. The ridge is traversed by minor road, whichkeeps to highr ground on South East line, this is maintained when it divides into two. One lane runs along the side of the shallow valley at a height of about 120m. Nowhere is there a connection between 2 routes by way of the scarp face. the lanes are bordered by substantial hedges, generally. There are three groups of council type timber houses set conspicuously at the roadside, with elsewhere, dispersed farms, cottages and few modern houses.
